89
90#define PACKET_MAX_SIZE (256 * 1024)
91
92struct packet_state {
93 u_int32_t seqnr;
94 u_int32_t packets;
95 u_int64_t blocks;
96 u_int64_t bytes;
97};
98
99struct packet {
100 TAILQ_ENTRY(packet) next;
101 u_char type;
102 struct sshbuf *payload;
103};
104
105struct session_state {
106 /*
107 * This variable contains the file descriptors used for
108 * communicating with the other side. connection_in is used for
109 * reading; connection_out for writing. These can be the same
110 * descriptor, in which case it is assumed to be a socket.
111 */
112 int connection_in;
113 int connection_out;
114
115 /* Protocol flags for the remote side. */
116 u_int remote_protocol_flags;
117
118 /* Encryption context for receiving data. Only used for decryption. */
119 struct sshcipher_ctx *receive_context;
120
121 /* Encryption context for sending data. Only used for encryption. */
122 struct sshcipher_ctx *send_context;
123
124 /* Buffer for raw input data from the socket. */
125 struct sshbuf *input;
126
127 /* Buffer for raw output data going to the socket. */
128 struct sshbuf *output;
129
130 /* Buffer for the partial outgoing packet being constructed. */
131 struct sshbuf *outgoing_packet;
132
133 /* Buffer for the incoming packet currently being processed. */
134 struct sshbuf *incoming_packet;
135
136 /* Scratch buffer for packet compression/decompression. */
137 struct sshbuf *compression_buffer;
138
139 /* Incoming/outgoing compression dictionaries */
140 z_stream compression_in_stream;
141 z_stream compression_out_stream;
142 int compression_in_started;
143 int compression_out_started;
144 int compression_in_failures;
145 int compression_out_failures;
146
147 /* default maximum packet size */
148 u_int max_packet_size;
149
150 /* Flag indicating whether this module has been initialized. */
151 int initialized;
152
153 /* Set to true if the connection is interactive. */
154 int interactive_mode;
155
156 /* Set to true if we are the server side. */
157 int server_side;
158
159 /* Set to true if we are authenticated. */
160 int after_authentication;
161
162 int keep_alive_timeouts;
163
164 /* The maximum time that we will wait to send or receive a packet */
165 int packet_timeout_ms;
166
167 /* Session key information for Encryption and MAC */
168 struct newkeys *newkeys[MODE_MAX];
169 struct packet_state p_read, p_send;
170
171 /* Volume-based rekeying */
172 u_int64_t max_blocks_in, max_blocks_out, rekey_limit;
173
174 /* Time-based rekeying */
175 u_int32_t rekey_interval; /* how often in seconds */
176 time_t rekey_time; /* time of last rekeying */
177
178 /* roundup current message to extra_pad bytes */
179 u_char extra_pad;
180
181 /* XXX discard incoming data after MAC error */
182 u_int packet_discard;
183 size_t packet_discard_mac_already;
184 struct sshmac *packet_discard_mac;
185
186 /* Used in packet_read_poll2() */
187 u_int packlen;
188
189 /* Used in packet_send2 */
190 int rekeying;
191
192 /* Used in ssh_packet_send_mux() */
193 int mux;
194
195 /* Used in packet_set_interactive */
196 int set_interactive_called;
197
198 /* Used in packet_set_maxsize */
199 int set_maxsize_called;
200
201 /* One-off warning about weak ciphers */
202 int cipher_warning_done;
203
204 /* Hook for fuzzing inbound packets */
205 ssh_packet_hook_fn *hook_in;
206 void *hook_in_ctx;
207
208 TAILQ_HEAD(, packet) outgoing;
209};
210
211struct ssh *
212ssh_alloc_session_state(void)
213{
214 struct ssh *ssh = NULL;
215 struct session_state *state = NULL;
216
217 if ((ssh = calloc(1, sizeof(*ssh))) == NULL ||
218 (state = calloc(1, sizeof(*state))) == NULL ||
219 (ssh->kex = kex_new()) == NULL ||
220 (state->input = sshbuf_new()) == NULL ||
221 (state->output = sshbuf_new()) == NULL ||
222 (state->outgoing_packet = sshbuf_new()) == NULL ||
223 (state->incoming_packet = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
224 goto fail;
225 TAILQ_INIT(&state->outgoing);
226 TAILQ_INIT(&ssh->private_keys);
227 TAILQ_INIT(&ssh->public_keys);
228 state->connection_in = -1;
229 state->connection_out = -1;
230 state->max_packet_size = 32768;
231 state->packet_timeout_ms = -1;
232 state->p_send.packets = state->p_read.packets = 0;
233 state->initialized = 1;
234 /*
235 * ssh_packet_send2() needs to queue packets until
236 * we've done the initial key exchange.
237 */
238 state->rekeying = 1;
239 ssh->state = state;
240 return ssh;
241 fail:
242 if (ssh) {
243 kex_free(ssh->kex);
244 free(ssh);
245 }
246 if (state) {
247 sshbuf_free(state->input);
248 sshbuf_free(state->output);
249 sshbuf_free(state->incoming_packet);
250 sshbuf_free(state->outgoing_packet);
251 free(state);
252 }
253 return NULL;
254}
255
256void
257ssh_packet_set_input_hook(struct ssh *ssh, ssh_packet_hook_fn *hook, void *ctx)
258{
259 ssh->state->hook_in = hook;
260 ssh->state->hook_in_ctx = ctx;
261}
262
263/* Returns nonzero if rekeying is in progress */
264int
265ssh_packet_is_rekeying(struct ssh *ssh)
266{
267 return ssh->state->rekeying || ssh->kex->done == 0;
268}
269
270/*
271 * Sets the descriptors used for communication.
272 */
273struct ssh *
274ssh_packet_set_connection(struct ssh *ssh, int fd_in, int fd_out)
275{
276 struct session_state *state;
277 const struct sshcipher *none = cipher_by_name("none");
278 int r;
279
280 if (none == NULL) {
281 error("%s: cannot load cipher 'none'", __func__);
282 return NULL;
283 }
284 if (ssh == NULL)
285 ssh = ssh_alloc_session_state();
286 if (ssh == NULL) {
287 error("%s: cound not allocate state", __func__);
288 return NULL;
289 }
290 state = ssh->state;
291 state->connection_in = fd_in;
292 state->connection_out = fd_out;
293 if ((r = cipher_init(&state->send_context, none,
294 (const u_char *)"", 0, NULL, 0, CIPHER_ENCRYPT)) != 0 ||
295 (r = cipher_init(&state->receive_context, none,
296 (const u_char *)"", 0, NULL, 0, CIPHER_DECRYPT)) != 0) {
297 error("%s: cipher_init failed: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
298 free(ssh); /* XXX need ssh_free_session_state? */
299 return NULL;
300 }
301 state->newkeys[MODE_IN] = state->newkeys[MODE_OUT] = NULL;
302 /*
303 * Cache the IP address of the remote connection for use in error
304 * messages that might be generated after the connection has closed.
305 */
306 (void)ssh_remote_ipaddr(ssh);
307 return ssh;
308}
309
310void
311ssh_packet_set_timeout(struct ssh *ssh, int timeout, int count)
312{
313 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
314
315 if (timeout <= 0 || count <= 0) {
316 state->packet_timeout_ms = -1;
317 return;
318 }
319 if ((INT_MAX / 1000) / count < timeout)
320 state->packet_timeout_ms = INT_MAX;
321 else
322 state->packet_timeout_ms = timeout * count * 1000;
323}
324
325void
326ssh_packet_set_mux(struct ssh *ssh)
327{
328 ssh->state->mux = 1;
329 ssh->state->rekeying = 0;
330}
331
332int
333ssh_packet_get_mux(struct ssh *ssh)
334{
335 return ssh->state->mux;
336}
337
338int
339ssh_packet_set_log_preamble(struct ssh *ssh, const char *fmt, ...)
340{
341 va_list args;
342 int r;
343
344 free(ssh->log_preamble);
345 if (fmt == NULL)
346 ssh->log_preamble = NULL;
347 else {
348 va_start(args, fmt);
349 r = vasprintf(&ssh->log_preamble, fmt, args);
350 va_end(args);
351 if (r < 0 || ssh->log_preamble == NULL)
352 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
353 }
354 return 0;
355}
356
357int
358ssh_packet_stop_discard(struct ssh *ssh)
359{
360 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
361 int r;
362
363 if (state->packet_discard_mac) {
364 char buf[1024];
365 size_t dlen = PACKET_MAX_SIZE;
366
367 if (dlen > state->packet_discard_mac_already)
368 dlen -= state->packet_discard_mac_already;
369 memset(buf, 'a', sizeof(buf));
370 while (sshbuf_len(state->incoming_packet) < dlen)
371 if ((r = sshbuf_put(state->incoming_packet, buf,
372 sizeof(buf))) != 0)
373 return r;
374 (void) mac_compute(state->packet_discard_mac,
375 state->p_read.seqnr,
376 sshbuf_ptr(state->incoming_packet), dlen,
377 NULL, 0);
378 }
379 logit("Finished discarding for %.200s port %d",
380 ssh_remote_ipaddr(ssh), ssh_remote_port(ssh));
381 return SSH_ERR_MAC_INVALID;
382}
383
384static int
385ssh_packet_start_discard(struct ssh *ssh, struct sshenc *enc,
386 struct sshmac *mac, size_t mac_already, u_int discard)
387{
388 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
389 int r;
390
391 if (enc == NULL || !cipher_is_cbc(enc->cipher) || (mac && mac->etm)) {
392 if ((r = sshpkt_disconnect(ssh, "Packet corrupt")) != 0)
393 return r;
394 return SSH_ERR_MAC_INVALID;
395 }
396 /*
397 * Record number of bytes over which the mac has already
398 * been computed in order to minimize timing attacks.
399 */
400 if (mac && mac->enabled) {
401 state->packet_discard_mac = mac;
402 state->packet_discard_mac_already = mac_already;
403 }
404 if (sshbuf_len(state->input) >= discard)
405 return ssh_packet_stop_discard(ssh);
406 state->packet_discard = discard - sshbuf_len(state->input);
407 return 0;
408}
409
410/* Returns 1 if remote host is connected via socket, 0 if not. */
411
412int
413ssh_packet_connection_is_on_socket(struct ssh *ssh)
414{
415 struct session_state *state;
416 struct sockaddr_storage from, to;
417 socklen_t fromlen, tolen;
418
419 if (ssh == NULL || ssh->state == NULL)
420 return 0;
421
422 state = ssh->state;
423 if (state->connection_in == -1 || state->connection_out == -1)
424 return 0;
425 /* filedescriptors in and out are the same, so it's a socket */
426 if (state->connection_in == state->connection_out)
427 return 1;
428 fromlen = sizeof(from);
429 memset(&from, 0, sizeof(from));
430 if (getpeername(state->connection_in, (struct sockaddr *)&from,
431 &fromlen) < 0)
432 return 0;
433 tolen = sizeof(to);
434 memset(&to, 0, sizeof(to));
435 if (getpeername(state->connection_out, (struct sockaddr *)&to,
436 &tolen) < 0)
437 return 0;
438 if (fromlen != tolen || memcmp(&from, &to, fromlen) != 0)
439 return 0;
440 if (from.ss_family != AF_INET && from.ss_family != AF_INET6)
441 return 0;
442 return 1;
443}
444
445void
446ssh_packet_get_bytes(struct ssh *ssh, u_int64_t *ibytes, u_int64_t *obytes)
447{
448 if (ibytes)
449 *ibytes = ssh->state->p_read.bytes;
450 if (obytes)
451 *obytes = ssh->state->p_send.bytes;
452}
453
454int
455ssh_packet_connection_af(struct ssh *ssh)
456{
457 struct sockaddr_storage to;
458 socklen_t tolen = sizeof(to);
459
460 memset(&to, 0, sizeof(to));
461 if (getsockname(ssh->state->connection_out, (struct sockaddr *)&to,
462 &tolen) < 0)
463 return 0;
464#ifdef IPV4_IN_IPV6
465 if (to.ss_family == AF_INET6 &&
466 IN6_IS_ADDR_V4MAPPED(&((struct sockaddr_in6 *)&to)->sin6_addr))
467 return AF_INET;
468#endif
469 return to.ss_family;
470}
471
472/* Sets the connection into non-blocking mode. */
473
474void
475ssh_packet_set_nonblocking(struct ssh *ssh)
476{
477 /* Set the socket into non-blocking mode. */
478 set_nonblock(ssh->state->connection_in);
479
480 if (ssh->state->connection_out != ssh->state->connection_in)
481 set_nonblock(ssh->state->connection_out);
482}
483
484/* Returns the socket used for reading. */
485
486int
487ssh_packet_get_connection_in(struct ssh *ssh)
488{
489 return ssh->state->connection_in;
490}
491
492/* Returns the descriptor used for writing. */
493
494int
495ssh_packet_get_connection_out(struct ssh *ssh)
496{
497 return ssh->state->connection_out;
498}
499
500/*
501 * Returns the IP-address of the remote host as a string. The returned
502 * string must not be freed.
503 */
504
505const char *
506ssh_remote_ipaddr(struct ssh *ssh)
507{
508 int sock;
509
510 /* Check whether we have cached the ipaddr. */
511 if (ssh->remote_ipaddr == NULL) {
512 if (ssh_packet_connection_is_on_socket(ssh)) {
513 sock = ssh->state->connection_in;
514 ssh->remote_ipaddr = get_peer_ipaddr(sock);
515 ssh->remote_port = get_peer_port(sock);
516 ssh->local_ipaddr = get_local_ipaddr(sock);
517 ssh->local_port = get_local_port(sock);
518 } else {
519 ssh->remote_ipaddr = strdup("UNKNOWN");
520 ssh->remote_port = 65535;
521 ssh->local_ipaddr = strdup("UNKNOWN");
522 ssh->local_port = 65535;
523 }
524 }
525 return ssh->remote_ipaddr;
526}
527
528/* Returns the port number of the remote host. */
529
530int
531ssh_remote_port(struct ssh *ssh)
532{
533 (void)ssh_remote_ipaddr(ssh); /* Will lookup and cache. */
534 return ssh->remote_port;
535}
536
537/*
538 * Returns the IP-address of the local host as a string. The returned
539 * string must not be freed.
540 */
541
542const char *
543ssh_local_ipaddr(struct ssh *ssh)
544{
545 (void)ssh_remote_ipaddr(ssh); /* Will lookup and cache. */
546 return ssh->local_ipaddr;
547}
548
549/* Returns the port number of the local host. */
550
551int
552ssh_local_port(struct ssh *ssh)
553{
554 (void)ssh_remote_ipaddr(ssh); /* Will lookup and cache. */
555 return ssh->local_port;
556}
557
558/* Returns the routing domain of the input socket, or NULL if unavailable */
559const char *
560ssh_packet_rdomain_in(struct ssh *ssh)
561{
562 if (ssh->rdomain_in != NULL)
563 return ssh->rdomain_in;
564 if (!ssh_packet_connection_is_on_socket(ssh))
565 return NULL;
566 ssh->rdomain_in = get_rdomain(ssh->state->connection_in);
567 return ssh->rdomain_in;
568}
569
570/* Closes the connection and clears and frees internal data structures. */
571
572static void
573ssh_packet_close_internal(struct ssh *ssh, int do_close)
574{
575 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
576 u_int mode;
577
578 if (!state->initialized)
579 return;
580 state->initialized = 0;
581 if (do_close) {
582 if (state->connection_in == state->connection_out) {
583 close(state->connection_out);
584 } else {
585 close(state->connection_in);
586 close(state->connection_out);
587 }
588 }
589 sshbuf_free(state->input);
590 sshbuf_free(state->output);
591 sshbuf_free(state->outgoing_packet);
592 sshbuf_free(state->incoming_packet);
593 for (mode = 0; mode < MODE_MAX; mode++) {
594 kex_free_newkeys(state->newkeys[mode]); /* current keys */
595 state->newkeys[mode] = NULL;
596 ssh_clear_newkeys(ssh, mode); /* next keys */
597 }
598 /* compression state is in shared mem, so we can only release it once */
599 if (do_close && state->compression_buffer) {
600 sshbuf_free(state->compression_buffer);
601 if (state->compression_out_started) {
602 z_streamp stream = &state->compression_out_stream;
603 debug("compress outgoing: "
604 "raw data %llu, compressed %llu, factor %.2f",
605 (unsigned long long)stream->total_in,
606 (unsigned long long)stream->total_out,
607 stream->total_in == 0 ? 0.0 :
608 (double) stream->total_out / stream->total_in);
609 if (state->compression_out_failures == 0)
610 deflateEnd(stream);
611 }
612 if (state->compression_in_started) {
613 z_streamp stream = &state->compression_in_stream;
614 debug("compress incoming: "
615 "raw data %llu, compressed %llu, factor %.2f",
616 (unsigned long long)stream->total_out,
617 (unsigned long long)stream->total_in,
618 stream->total_out == 0 ? 0.0 :
619 (double) stream->total_in / stream->total_out);
620 if (state->compression_in_failures == 0)
621 inflateEnd(stream);
622 }
623 }
624 cipher_free(state->send_context);
625 cipher_free(state->receive_context);
626 state->send_context = state->receive_context = NULL;
627 if (do_close) {
628 free(ssh->local_ipaddr);
629 ssh->local_ipaddr = NULL;
630 free(ssh->remote_ipaddr);
631 ssh->remote_ipaddr = NULL;
632 free(ssh->state);
633 ssh->state = NULL;
634 }
635}
636
637void
638ssh_packet_close(struct ssh *ssh)
639{
640 ssh_packet_close_internal(ssh, 1);
641}
642
643void
644ssh_packet_clear_keys(struct ssh *ssh)
645{
646 ssh_packet_close_internal(ssh, 0);
647}
648
649/* Sets remote side protocol flags. */
650
651void
652ssh_packet_set_protocol_flags(struct ssh *ssh, u_int protocol_flags)
653{
654 ssh->state->remote_protocol_flags = protocol_flags;
655}
656
657/* Returns the remote protocol flags set earlier by the above function. */
658
659u_int
660ssh_packet_get_protocol_flags(struct ssh *ssh)
661{
662 return ssh->state->remote_protocol_flags;
663}
664
665/*
666 * Starts packet compression from the next packet on in both directions.
667 * Level is compression level 1 (fastest) - 9 (slow, best) as in gzip.
668 */
669
670static int
671ssh_packet_init_compression(struct ssh *ssh)
672{
673 if (!ssh->state->compression_buffer &&
674 ((ssh->state->compression_buffer = sshbuf_new()) == NULL))
675 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
676 return 0;
677}
678
679static int
680start_compression_out(struct ssh *ssh, int level)
681{
682 if (level < 1 || level > 9)
683 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
684 debug("Enabling compression at level %d.", level);
685 if (ssh->state->compression_out_started == 1)
686 deflateEnd(&ssh->state->compression_out_stream);
687 switch (deflateInit(&ssh->state->compression_out_stream, level)) {
688 case Z_OK:
689 ssh->state->compression_out_started = 1;
690 break;
691 case Z_MEM_ERROR:
692 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
693 default:
694 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
695 }
696 return 0;
697}
698
699static int
700start_compression_in(struct ssh *ssh)
701{
702 if (ssh->state->compression_in_started == 1)
703 inflateEnd(&ssh->state->compression_in_stream);
704 switch (inflateInit(&ssh->state->compression_in_stream)) {
705 case Z_OK:
706 ssh->state->compression_in_started = 1;
707 break;
708 case Z_MEM_ERROR:
709 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
710 default:
711 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
712 }
713 return 0;
714}
715
716/* XXX remove need for separate compression buffer */
717static int
718compress_buffer(struct ssh *ssh, struct sshbuf *in, struct sshbuf *out)
719{
720 u_char buf[4096];
721 int r, status;
722
723 if (ssh->state->compression_out_started != 1)
724 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
725
726 /* This case is not handled below. */
727 if (sshbuf_len(in) == 0)
728 return 0;
729
730 /* Input is the contents of the input buffer. */
731 if ((ssh->state->compression_out_stream.next_in =
732 sshbuf_mutable_ptr(in)) == NULL)
733 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
734 ssh->state->compression_out_stream.avail_in = sshbuf_len(in);
735
736 /* Loop compressing until deflate() returns with avail_out != 0. */
737 do {
738 /* Set up fixed-size output buffer. */
739 ssh->state->compression_out_stream.next_out = buf;
740 ssh->state->compression_out_stream.avail_out = sizeof(buf);
741
742 /* Compress as much data into the buffer as possible. */
743 status = deflate(&ssh->state->compression_out_stream,
744 Z_PARTIAL_FLUSH);
745 switch (status) {
746 case Z_MEM_ERROR:
747 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
748 case Z_OK:
749 /* Append compressed data to output_buffer. */
750 if ((r = sshbuf_put(out, buf, sizeof(buf) -
751 ssh->state->compression_out_stream.avail_out)) != 0)
752 return r;
753 break;
754 case Z_STREAM_ERROR:
755 default:
756 ssh->state->compression_out_failures++;
757 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
758 }
759 } while (ssh->state->compression_out_stream.avail_out == 0);
760 return 0;
761}
762
763static int
764uncompress_buffer(struct ssh *ssh, struct sshbuf *in, struct sshbuf *out)
765{
766 u_char buf[4096];
767 int r, status;
768
769 if (ssh->state->compression_in_started != 1)
770 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
771
772 if ((ssh->state->compression_in_stream.next_in =
773 sshbuf_mutable_ptr(in)) == NULL)
774 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
775 ssh->state->compression_in_stream.avail_in = sshbuf_len(in);
776
777 for (;;) {
778 /* Set up fixed-size output buffer. */
779 ssh->state->compression_in_stream.next_out = buf;
780 ssh->state->compression_in_stream.avail_out = sizeof(buf);
781
782 status = inflate(&ssh->state->compression_in_stream,
783 Z_PARTIAL_FLUSH);
784 switch (status) {
785 case Z_OK:
786 if ((r = sshbuf_put(out, buf, sizeof(buf) -
787 ssh->state->compression_in_stream.avail_out)) != 0)
788 return r;
789 break;
790 case Z_BUF_ERROR:
791 /*
792 * Comments in zlib.h say that we should keep calling
793 * inflate() until we get an error. This appears to
794 * be the error that we get.
795 */
796 return 0;
797 case Z_DATA_ERROR:
798 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
799 case Z_MEM_ERROR:
800 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
801 case Z_STREAM_ERROR:
802 default:
803 ssh->state->compression_in_failures++;
804 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
805 }
806 }
807 /* NOTREACHED */
808}
809
810void
811ssh_clear_newkeys(struct ssh *ssh, int mode)
812{
813 if (ssh->kex && ssh->kex->newkeys[mode]) {
814 kex_free_newkeys(ssh->kex->newkeys[mode]);
815 ssh->kex->newkeys[mode] = NULL;
816 }
817}
818
819int
820ssh_set_newkeys(struct ssh *ssh, int mode)
821{
822 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
823 struct sshenc *enc;
824 struct sshmac *mac;
825 struct sshcomp *comp;
826 struct sshcipher_ctx **ccp;
827 struct packet_state *ps;
828 u_int64_t *max_blocks;
829 const char *wmsg;
830 int r, crypt_type;
831 const char *dir = mode == MODE_OUT ? "out" : "in";
832
833 debug2("set_newkeys: mode %d", mode);
834
835 if (mode == MODE_OUT) {
836 ccp = &state->send_context;
837 crypt_type = CIPHER_ENCRYPT;
838 ps = &state->p_send;
839 max_blocks = &state->max_blocks_out;
840 } else {
841 ccp = &state->receive_context;
842 crypt_type = CIPHER_DECRYPT;
843 ps = &state->p_read;
844 max_blocks = &state->max_blocks_in;
845 }
846 if (state->newkeys[mode] != NULL) {
847 debug("%s: rekeying %s, input %llu bytes %llu blocks, "
848 "output %llu bytes %llu blocks", __func__, dir,
849 (unsigned long long)state->p_read.bytes,
850 (unsigned long long)state->p_read.blocks,
851 (unsigned long long)state->p_send.bytes,
852 (unsigned long long)state->p_send.blocks);
853 kex_free_newkeys(state->newkeys[mode]);
854 state->newkeys[mode] = NULL;
855 }
856 /* note that both bytes and the seqnr are not reset */
857 ps->packets = ps->blocks = 0;
858 /* move newkeys from kex to state */
859 if ((state->newkeys[mode] = ssh->kex->newkeys[mode]) == NULL)
860 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
861 ssh->kex->newkeys[mode] = NULL;
862 enc = &state->newkeys[mode]->enc;
863 mac = &state->newkeys[mode]->mac;
864 comp = &state->newkeys[mode]->comp;
865 if (cipher_authlen(enc->cipher) == 0) {
866 if ((r = mac_init(mac)) != 0)
867 return r;
868 }
869 mac->enabled = 1;
870 DBG(debug("%s: cipher_init_context: %s", __func__, dir));
871 cipher_free(*ccp);
872 *ccp = NULL;
873 if ((r = cipher_init(ccp, enc->cipher, enc->key, enc->key_len,
874 enc->iv, enc->iv_len, crypt_type)) != 0)
875 return r;
876 if (!state->cipher_warning_done &&
877 (wmsg = cipher_warning_message(*ccp)) != NULL) {
878 error("Warning: %s", wmsg);
879 state->cipher_warning_done = 1;
880 }
881 /* Deleting the keys does not gain extra security */
882 /* explicit_bzero(enc->iv, enc->block_size);
883 explicit_bzero(enc->key, enc->key_len);
884 explicit_bzero(mac->key, mac->key_len); */
885 if ((comp->type == COMP_ZLIB ||
886 (comp->type == COMP_DELAYED &&
887 state->after_authentication)) && comp->enabled == 0) {
888 if ((r = ssh_packet_init_compression(ssh)) < 0)
889 return r;
890 if (mode == MODE_OUT) {
891 if ((r = start_compression_out(ssh, 6)) != 0)
892 return r;
893 } else {
894 if ((r = start_compression_in(ssh)) != 0)
895 return r;
896 }
897 comp->enabled = 1;
898 }
899 /*
900 * The 2^(blocksize*2) limit is too expensive for 3DES,
901 * so enforce a 1GB limit for small blocksizes.
902 * See RFC4344 section 3.2.
903 */
904 if (enc->block_size >= 16)
905 *max_blocks = (u_int64_t)1 << (enc->block_size*2);
906 else
907 *max_blocks = ((u_int64_t)1 << 30) / enc->block_size;
908 if (state->rekey_limit)
909 *max_blocks = MINIMUM(*max_blocks,
910 state->rekey_limit / enc->block_size);
911 debug("rekey %s after %llu blocks", dir,
912 (unsigned long long)*max_blocks);
913 return 0;
914}
915
916#define MAX_PACKETS (1U<<31)
917static int
918ssh_packet_need_rekeying(struct ssh *ssh, u_int outbound_packet_len)
919{
920 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
921 u_int32_t out_blocks;
922
923 /* XXX client can't cope with rekeying pre-auth */
924 if (!state->after_authentication)
925 return 0;
926
927 /* Haven't keyed yet or KEX in progress. */
928 if (ssh_packet_is_rekeying(ssh))
929 return 0;
930
931 /* Peer can't rekey */
932 if (ssh->compat & SSH_BUG_NOREKEY)
933 return 0;
934
935 /*
936 * Permit one packet in or out per rekey - this allows us to
937 * make progress when rekey limits are very small.
938 */
939 if (state->p_send.packets == 0 && state->p_read.packets == 0)
940 return 0;
941
942 /* Time-based rekeying */
943 if (state->rekey_interval != 0 &&
944 (int64_t)state->rekey_time + state->rekey_interval <= monotime())
945 return 1;
946
947 /*
948 * Always rekey when MAX_PACKETS sent in either direction
949 * As per RFC4344 section 3.1 we do this after 2^31 packets.
950 */
951 if (state->p_send.packets > MAX_PACKETS ||
952 state->p_read.packets > MAX_PACKETS)
953 return 1;
954
955 /* Rekey after (cipher-specific) maximum blocks */
956 out_blocks = ROUNDUP(outbound_packet_len,
957 state->newkeys[MODE_OUT]->enc.block_size);
958 return (state->max_blocks_out &&
959 (state->p_send.blocks + out_blocks > state->max_blocks_out)) ||
960 (state->max_blocks_in &&
961 (state->p_read.blocks > state->max_blocks_in));
962}
963
964/*
965 * Delayed compression for SSH2 is enabled after authentication:
966 * This happens on the server side after a SSH2_MSG_USERAUTH_SUCCESS is sent,
967 * and on the client side after a SSH2_MSG_USERAUTH_SUCCESS is received.
968 */
969static int
970ssh_packet_enable_delayed_compress(struct ssh *ssh)
971{
972 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
973 struct sshcomp *comp = NULL;
974 int r, mode;
975
976 /*
977 * Remember that we are past the authentication step, so rekeying
978 * with COMP_DELAYED will turn on compression immediately.
979 */
980 state->after_authentication = 1;
981 for (mode = 0; mode < MODE_MAX; mode++) {
982 /* protocol error: USERAUTH_SUCCESS received before NEWKEYS */
983 if (state->newkeys[mode] == NULL)
984 continue;
985 comp = &state->newkeys[mode]->comp;
986 if (comp && !comp->enabled && comp->type == COMP_DELAYED) {
987 if ((r = ssh_packet_init_compression(ssh)) != 0)
988 return r;
989 if (mode == MODE_OUT) {
990 if ((r = start_compression_out(ssh, 6)) != 0)
991 return r;
992 } else {
993 if ((r = start_compression_in(ssh)) != 0)
994 return r;
995 }
996 comp->enabled = 1;
997 }
998 }
999 return 0;
1000}
1001
1002/* Used to mute debug logging for noisy packet types */
1003int
1004ssh_packet_log_type(u_char type)
1005{
1006 switch (type) {
1007 case SSH2_MSG_CHANNEL_DATA:
1008 case SSH2_MSG_CHANNEL_EXTENDED_DATA:
1009 case SSH2_MSG_CHANNEL_WINDOW_ADJUST:
1010 return 0;
1011 default:
1012 return 1;
1013 }
1014}
1015
1016/*
1017 * Finalize packet in SSH2 format (compress, mac, encrypt, enqueue)
1018 */
1019int
1020ssh_packet_send2_wrapped(struct ssh *ssh)
1021{
1022 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
1023 u_char type, *cp, macbuf[SSH_DIGEST_MAX_LENGTH];
1024 u_char tmp, padlen, pad = 0;
1025 u_int authlen = 0, aadlen = 0;
1026 u_int len;
1027 struct sshenc *enc = NULL;
1028 struct sshmac *mac = NULL;
1029 struct sshcomp *comp = NULL;
1030 int r, block_size;
1031
1032 if (state->newkeys[MODE_OUT] != NULL) {
1033 enc = &state->newkeys[MODE_OUT]->enc;
1034 mac = &state->newkeys[MODE_OUT]->mac;
1035 comp = &state->newkeys[MODE_OUT]->comp;
1036 /* disable mac for authenticated encryption */
1037 if ((authlen = cipher_authlen(enc->cipher)) != 0)
1038 mac = NULL;
1039 }
1040 block_size = enc ? enc->block_size : 8;
1041 aadlen = (mac && mac->enabled && mac->etm) || authlen ? 4 : 0;
1042
1043 type = (sshbuf_ptr(state->outgoing_packet))[5];
1044 if (ssh_packet_log_type(type))
1045 debug3("send packet: type %u", type);
1046#ifdef PACKET_DEBUG
1047 fprintf(stderr, "plain: ");
1048 sshbuf_dump(state->outgoing_packet, stderr);
1049#endif
1050
1051 if (comp && comp->enabled) {
1052 len = sshbuf_len(state->outgoing_packet);
1053 /* skip header, compress only payload */
1054 if ((r = sshbuf_consume(state->outgoing_packet, 5)) != 0)
1055 goto out;
1056 sshbuf_reset(state->compression_buffer);
1057 if ((r = compress_buffer(ssh, state->outgoing_packet,
1058 state->compression_buffer)) != 0)
1059 goto out;
1060 sshbuf_reset(state->outgoing_packet);
1061 if ((r = sshbuf_put(state->outgoing_packet,
1062 "\0\0\0\0\0", 5)) != 0 ||
1063 (r = sshbuf_putb(state->outgoing_packet,
1064 state->compression_buffer)) != 0)
1065 goto out;
1066 DBG(debug("compression: raw %d compressed %zd", len,
1067 sshbuf_len(state->outgoing_packet)));
1068 }
1069
1070 /* sizeof (packet_len + pad_len + payload) */
1071 len = sshbuf_len(state->outgoing_packet);
1072
1073 /*
1074 * calc size of padding, alloc space, get random data,
1075 * minimum padding is 4 bytes
1076 */
1077 len -= aadlen; /* packet length is not encrypted for EtM modes */
1078 padlen = block_size - (len % block_size);
1079 if (padlen < 4)
1080 padlen += block_size;
1081 if (state->extra_pad) {
1082 tmp = state->extra_pad;
1083 state->extra_pad =
1084 ROUNDUP(state->extra_pad, block_size);
1085 /* check if roundup overflowed */
1086 if (state->extra_pad < tmp)
1087 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
1088 tmp = (len + padlen) % state->extra_pad;
1089 /* Check whether pad calculation below will underflow */
1090 if (tmp > state->extra_pad)
1091 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
1092 pad = state->extra_pad - tmp;
1093 DBG(debug3("%s: adding %d (len %d padlen %d extra_pad %d)",
1094 __func__, pad, len, padlen, state->extra_pad));
1095 tmp = padlen;
1096 padlen += pad;
1097 /* Check whether padlen calculation overflowed */
1098 if (padlen < tmp)
1099 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT; /* overflow */
1100 state->extra_pad = 0;
1101 }
1102 if ((r = sshbuf_reserve(state->outgoing_packet, padlen, &cp)) != 0)
1103 goto out;
1104 if (enc && !cipher_ctx_is_plaintext(state->send_context)) {
1105 /* random padding */
1106 arc4random_buf(cp, padlen);
1107 } else {
1108 /* clear padding */
1109 explicit_bzero(cp, padlen);
1110 }
1111 /* sizeof (packet_len + pad_len + payload + padding) */
1112 len = sshbuf_len(state->outgoing_packet);
1113 cp = sshbuf_mutable_ptr(state->outgoing_packet);
1114 if (cp == NULL) {
1115 r = SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
1116 goto out;
1117 }
1118 /* packet_length includes payload, padding and padding length field */
1119 POKE_U32(cp, len - 4);
1120 cp[4] = padlen;
1121 DBG(debug("send: len %d (includes padlen %d, aadlen %d)",
1122 len, padlen, aadlen));
1123
1124 /* compute MAC over seqnr and packet(length fields, payload, padding) */
1125 if (mac && mac->enabled && !mac->etm) {
1126 if ((r = mac_compute(mac, state->p_send.seqnr,
1127 sshbuf_ptr(state->outgoing_packet), len,
1128 macbuf, sizeof(macbuf))) != 0)
1129 goto out;
1130 DBG(debug("done calc MAC out #%d", state->p_send.seqnr));
1131 }
1132 /* encrypt packet and append to output buffer. */
1133 if ((r = sshbuf_reserve(state->output,
1134 sshbuf_len(state->outgoing_packet) + authlen, &cp)) != 0)
1135 goto out;
1136 if ((r = cipher_crypt(state->send_context, state->p_send.seqnr, cp,
1137 sshbuf_ptr(state->outgoing_packet),
1138 len - aadlen, aadlen, authlen)) != 0)
1139 goto out;
1140 /* append unencrypted MAC */
1141 if (mac && mac->enabled) {
1142 if (mac->etm) {
1143 /* EtM: compute mac over aadlen + cipher text */
1144 if ((r = mac_compute(mac, state->p_send.seqnr,
1145 cp, len, macbuf, sizeof(macbuf))) != 0)
1146 goto out;
1147 DBG(debug("done calc MAC(EtM) out #%d",
1148 state->p_send.seqnr));
1149 }
1150 if ((r = sshbuf_put(state->output, macbuf, mac->mac_len)) != 0)
1151 goto out;
1152 }
1153#ifdef PACKET_DEBUG
1154 fprintf(stderr, "encrypted: ");
1155 sshbuf_dump(state->output, stderr);
1156#endif
1157 /* increment sequence number for outgoing packets */
1158 if (++state->p_send.seqnr == 0)
1159 logit("outgoing seqnr wraps around");
1160 if (++state->p_send.packets == 0)
1161 if (!(ssh->compat & SSH_BUG_NOREKEY))
1162 return SSH_ERR_NEED_REKEY;
1163 state->p_send.blocks += len / block_size;
1164 state->p_send.bytes += len;
1165 sshbuf_reset(state->outgoing_packet);
1166
1167 if (type == SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS)
1168 r = ssh_set_newkeys(ssh, MODE_OUT);
1169 else if (type == SSH2_MSG_USERAUTH_SUCCESS && state->server_side)
1170 r = ssh_packet_enable_delayed_compress(ssh);
1171 else
1172 r = 0;
1173 out:
1174 if (r < 0)
1175 return r;
1176 else
1177 return len - 4;
1178}
1179
1180/* returns non-zero if the specified packet type is usec by KEX */
1181static int
1182ssh_packet_type_is_kex(u_char type)
1183{
1184 return
1185 type >= SSH2_MSG_TRANSPORT_MIN &&
1186 type <= SSH2_MSG_TRANSPORT_MAX &&
1187 type != SSH2_MSG_SERVICE_REQUEST &&
1188 type != SSH2_MSG_SERVICE_ACCEPT &&
1189 type != SSH2_MSG_EXT_INFO;
1190}
1191
1192int
1193ssh_packet_send2(struct ssh *ssh)
1194{
1195 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
1196 struct packet *p;
1197 u_char type;
1198 int r, need_rekey;
1199 int packet_length;
1200
1201 if (sshbuf_len(state->outgoing_packet) < 6)
1202 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
1203 type = sshbuf_ptr(state->outgoing_packet)[5];
1204 need_rekey = !ssh_packet_type_is_kex(type) &&
1205 ssh_packet_need_rekeying(ssh, sshbuf_len(state->outgoing_packet));
1206
1207 /*
1208 * During rekeying we can only send key exchange messages.
1209 * Queue everything else.
1210 */
1211 if ((need_rekey || state->rekeying) && !ssh_packet_type_is_kex(type)) {
1212 if (need_rekey)
1213 debug3("%s: rekex triggered", __func__);
1214 debug("enqueue packet: %u", type);
1215 p = calloc(1, sizeof(*p));
1216 if (p == NULL)
1217 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
1218 p->type = type;
1219 p->payload = state->outgoing_packet;
1220 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&state->outgoing, p, next);
1221 state->outgoing_packet = sshbuf_new();
1222 if (state->outgoing_packet == NULL)
1223 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
1224 if (need_rekey) {
1225 /*
1226 * This packet triggered a rekey, so send the
1227 * KEXINIT now.
1228 * NB. reenters this function via kex_start_rekex().
1229 */
1230 return kex_start_rekex(ssh);
1231 }
1232 return 0;
1233 }
1234
1235 /* rekeying starts with sending KEXINIT */
1236 if (type == SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT)
1237 state->rekeying = 1;
1238
1239 if ((r = ssh_packet_send2_wrapped(ssh)) < 0)
1240 return r;
1241
1242 packet_length = r;
1243
1244 /* after a NEWKEYS message we can send the complete queue */
1245 if (type == SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS) {
1246 state->rekeying = 0;
1247 state->rekey_time = monotime();
1248 while ((p = TAILQ_FIRST(&state->outgoing))) {
1249 type = p->type;
1250 /*
1251 * If this packet triggers a rekex, then skip the
1252 * remaining packets in the queue for now.
1253 * NB. re-enters this function via kex_start_rekex.
1254 */
1255 if (ssh_packet_need_rekeying(ssh,
1256 sshbuf_len(p->payload))) {
1257 debug3("%s: queued packet triggered rekex",
1258 __func__);
1259 return kex_start_rekex(ssh);
1260 }
1261 debug("dequeue packet: %u", type);
1262 sshbuf_free(state->outgoing_packet);
1263 state->outgoing_packet = p->payload;
1264 TAILQ_REMOVE(&state->outgoing, p, next);
1265 memset(p, 0, sizeof(*p));
1266 free(p);
1267 if ((r = ssh_packet_send2_wrapped(ssh)) < 0)
1268 return r;
1269 packet_length += r;
1270 }
1271 }
1272 return packet_length;
1273}
1274
1275/*
1276 * Waits until a packet has been received, and returns its type. Note that
1277 * no other data is processed until this returns, so this function should not
1278 * be used during the interactive session.
1279 */
1280
1281int
1282ssh_packet_read_seqnr(struct ssh *ssh, u_char *typep, u_int32_t *seqnr_p)
1283{
1284 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
1285 int len, r, ms_remain = 0;
1286 fd_set *setp;
1287 char buf[8192];
1288 struct timeval timeout, start, *timeoutp = NULL;
1289
1290 DBG(debug("packet_read()"));
1291
1292 setp = calloc(howmany(state->connection_in + 1,
1293 NFDBITS), sizeof(fd_mask));
1294 if (setp == NULL)
1295 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
1296
1297 /*
1298 * Since we are blocking, ensure that all written packets have
1299 * been sent.
1300 */
1301 if ((r = ssh_packet_write_wait(ssh)) < 0)
1302 goto out;
1303
1304 /* Stay in the loop until we have received a complete packet. */
1305 for (;;) {
1306 /* Try to read a packet from the buffer. */
1307 r = ssh_packet_read_poll_seqnr(ssh, typep, seqnr_p);
1308 if (r != 0)
1309 break;
1310 /* If we got a packet, return it. */
1311 if (*typep != SSH_MSG_NONE)
1312 break;
1313 /*
1314 * Otherwise, wait for some data to arrive, add it to the
1315 * buffer, and try again.
1316 */
1317 memset(setp, 0, howmany(state->connection_in + 1,
1318 NFDBITS) * sizeof(fd_mask));
1319 FD_SET(state->connection_in, setp);
1320
1321 if (state->packet_timeout_ms > 0) {
1322 ms_remain = state->packet_timeout_ms;
1323 timeoutp = &timeout;
1324 }
1325 /* Wait for some data to arrive. */
1326 for (;;) {
1327 if (state->packet_timeout_ms != -1) {
1328 ms_to_timeval(&timeout, ms_remain);
1329 monotime_tv(&start);
1330 }
1331 if ((r = select(state->connection_in + 1, setp,
1332 NULL, NULL, timeoutp)) >= 0)
1333 break;
1334 if (errno != EAGAIN && errno != EINTR) {
1335 r = SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR;
1336 goto out;
1337 }
1338 if (state->packet_timeout_ms == -1)
1339 continue;
1340 ms_subtract_diff(&start, &ms_remain);
1341 if (ms_remain <= 0) {
1342 r = 0;
1343 break;
1344 }
1345 }
1346 if (r == 0) {
1347 r = SSH_ERR_CONN_TIMEOUT;
1348 goto out;
1349 }
1350 /* Read data from the socket. */
1351 len = read(state->connection_in, buf, sizeof(buf));
1352 if (len == 0) {
1353 r = SSH_ERR_CONN_CLOSED;
1354 goto out;
1355 }
1356 if (len < 0) {
1357 r = SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR;
1358 goto out;
1359 }
1360
1361 /* Append it to the buffer. */
1362 if ((r = ssh_packet_process_incoming(ssh, buf, len)) != 0)
1363 goto out;
1364 }
1365 out:
1366 free(setp);
1367 return r;
1368}
1369
1370int
1371ssh_packet_read(struct ssh *ssh)
1372{
1373 u_char type;
1374 int r;
1375
1376 if ((r = ssh_packet_read_seqnr(ssh, &type, NULL)) != 0)
1377 fatal("%s: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1378 return type;
1379}
1380
1381/*
1382 * Waits until a packet has been received, verifies that its type matches
1383 * that given, and gives a fatal error and exits if there is a mismatch.
1384 */
1385
1386int
1387ssh_packet_read_expect(struct ssh *ssh, u_int expected_type)
1388{
1389 int r;
1390 u_char type;
1391
1392 if ((r = ssh_packet_read_seqnr(ssh, &type, NULL)) != 0)
1393 return r;
1394 if (type != expected_type) {
1395 if ((r = sshpkt_disconnect(ssh,
1396 "Protocol error: expected packet type %d, got %d",
1397 expected_type, type)) != 0)
1398 return r;
1399 return SSH_ERR_PROTOCOL_ERROR;
1400 }
1401 return 0;
1402}
1403
1404static int
1405ssh_packet_read_poll2_mux(struct ssh *ssh, u_char *typep, u_int32_t *seqnr_p)
1406{
1407 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
1408 const u_char *cp;
1409 size_t need;
1410 int r;
1411
1412 if (ssh->kex)
1413 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
1414 *typep = SSH_MSG_NONE;
1415 cp = sshbuf_ptr(state->input);
1416 if (state->packlen == 0) {
1417 if (sshbuf_len(state->input) < 4 + 1)
1418 return 0; /* packet is incomplete */
1419 state->packlen = PEEK_U32(cp);
1420 if (state->packlen < 4 + 1 ||
1421 state->packlen > PACKET_MAX_SIZE)
1422 return SSH_ERR_MESSAGE_INCOMPLETE;
1423 }
1424 need = state->packlen + 4;
1425 if (sshbuf_len(state->input) < need)
1426 return 0; /* packet is incomplete */
1427 sshbuf_reset(state->incoming_packet);
1428 if ((r = sshbuf_put(state->incoming_packet, cp + 4,
1429 state->packlen)) != 0 ||
1430 (r = sshbuf_consume(state->input, need)) != 0 ||
1431 (r = sshbuf_get_u8(state->incoming_packet, NULL)) != 0 ||
1432 (r = sshbuf_get_u8(state->incoming_packet, typep)) != 0)
1433 return r;
1434 if (ssh_packet_log_type(*typep))
1435 debug3("%s: type %u", __func__, *typep);
1436 /* sshbuf_dump(state->incoming_packet, stderr); */
1437 /* reset for next packet */
1438 state->packlen = 0;
1439 return r;
1440}
1441
1442int
1443ssh_packet_read_poll2(struct ssh *ssh, u_char *typep, u_int32_t *seqnr_p)
1444{
1445 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
1446 u_int padlen, need;
1447 u_char *cp;
1448 u_int maclen, aadlen = 0, authlen = 0, block_size;
1449 struct sshenc *enc = NULL;
1450 struct sshmac *mac = NULL;
1451 struct sshcomp *comp = NULL;
1452 int r;
1453
1454 if (state->mux)
1455 return ssh_packet_read_poll2_mux(ssh, typep, seqnr_p);
1456
1457 *typep = SSH_MSG_NONE;
1458
1459 if (state->packet_discard)
1460 return 0;
1461
1462 if (state->newkeys[MODE_IN] != NULL) {
1463 enc = &state->newkeys[MODE_IN]->enc;
1464 mac = &state->newkeys[MODE_IN]->mac;
1465 comp = &state->newkeys[MODE_IN]->comp;
1466 /* disable mac for authenticated encryption */
1467 if ((authlen = cipher_authlen(enc->cipher)) != 0)
1468 mac = NULL;
1469 }
1470 maclen = mac && mac->enabled ? mac->mac_len : 0;
1471 block_size = enc ? enc->block_size : 8;
1472 aadlen = (mac && mac->enabled && mac->etm) || authlen ? 4 : 0;
1473
1474 if (aadlen && state->packlen == 0) {
1475 if (cipher_get_length(state->receive_context,
1476 &state->packlen, state->p_read.seqnr,
1477 sshbuf_ptr(state->input), sshbuf_len(state->input)) != 0)
1478 return 0;
1479 if (state->packlen < 1 + 4 ||
1480 state->packlen > PACKET_MAX_SIZE) {
1481#ifdef PACKET_DEBUG
1482 sshbuf_dump(state->input, stderr);
1483#endif
1484 logit("Bad packet length %u.", state->packlen);
1485 if ((r = sshpkt_disconnect(ssh, "Packet corrupt")) != 0)
1486 return r;
1487 return SSH_ERR_CONN_CORRUPT;
1488 }
1489 sshbuf_reset(state->incoming_packet);
1490 } else if (state->packlen == 0) {
1491 /*
1492 * check if input size is less than the cipher block size,
1493 * decrypt first block and extract length of incoming packet
1494 */
1495 if (sshbuf_len(state->input) < block_size)
1496 return 0;
1497 sshbuf_reset(state->incoming_packet);
1498 if ((r = sshbuf_reserve(state->incoming_packet, block_size,
1499 &cp)) != 0)
1500 goto out;
1501 if ((r = cipher_crypt(state->receive_context,
1502 state->p_send.seqnr, cp, sshbuf_ptr(state->input),
1503 block_size, 0, 0)) != 0)
1504 goto out;
1505 state->packlen = PEEK_U32(sshbuf_ptr(state->incoming_packet));
1506 if (state->packlen < 1 + 4 ||
1507 state->packlen > PACKET_MAX_SIZE) {
1508#ifdef PACKET_DEBUG
1509 fprintf(stderr, "input: \n");
1510 sshbuf_dump(state->input, stderr);
1511 fprintf(stderr, "incoming_packet: \n");
1512 sshbuf_dump(state->incoming_packet, stderr);
1513#endif
1514 logit("Bad packet length %u.", state->packlen);
1515 return ssh_packet_start_discard(ssh, enc, mac, 0,
1516 PACKET_MAX_SIZE);
1517 }
1518 if ((r = sshbuf_consume(state->input, block_size)) != 0)
1519 goto out;
1520 }
1521 DBG(debug("input: packet len %u", state->packlen+4));
1522
1523 if (aadlen) {
1524 /* only the payload is encrypted */
1525 need = state->packlen;
1526 } else {
1527 /*
1528 * the payload size and the payload are encrypted, but we
1529 * have a partial packet of block_size bytes
1530 */
1531 need = 4 + state->packlen - block_size;
1532 }
1533 DBG(debug("partial packet: block %d, need %d, maclen %d, authlen %d,"
1534 " aadlen %d", block_size, need, maclen, authlen, aadlen));
1535 if (need % block_size != 0) {
1536 logit("padding error: need %d block %d mod %d",
1537 need, block_size, need % block_size);
1538 return ssh_packet_start_discard(ssh, enc, mac, 0,
1539 PACKET_MAX_SIZE - block_size);
1540 }
1541 /*
1542 * check if the entire packet has been received and
1543 * decrypt into incoming_packet:
1544 * 'aadlen' bytes are unencrypted, but authenticated.
1545 * 'need' bytes are encrypted, followed by either
1546 * 'authlen' bytes of authentication tag or
1547 * 'maclen' bytes of message authentication code.
1548 */
1549 if (sshbuf_len(state->input) < aadlen + need + authlen + maclen)
1550 return 0; /* packet is incomplete */
1551#ifdef PACKET_DEBUG
1552 fprintf(stderr, "read_poll enc/full: ");
1553 sshbuf_dump(state->input, stderr);
1554#endif
1555 /* EtM: check mac over encrypted input */
1556 if (mac && mac->enabled && mac->etm) {
1557 if ((r = mac_check(mac, state->p_read.seqnr,
1558 sshbuf_ptr(state->input), aadlen + need,
1559 sshbuf_ptr(state->input) + aadlen + need + authlen,
1560 maclen)) != 0) {
1561 if (r == SSH_ERR_MAC_INVALID)
1562 logit("Corrupted MAC on input.");
1563 goto out;
1564 }
1565 }
1566 if ((r = sshbuf_reserve(state->incoming_packet, aadlen + need,
1567 &cp)) != 0)
1568 goto out;
1569 if ((r = cipher_crypt(state->receive_context, state->p_read.seqnr, cp,
1570 sshbuf_ptr(state->input), need, aadlen, authlen)) != 0)
1571 goto out;
1572 if ((r = sshbuf_consume(state->input, aadlen + need + authlen)) != 0)
1573 goto out;
1574 if (mac && mac->enabled) {
1575 /* Not EtM: check MAC over cleartext */
1576 if (!mac->etm && (r = mac_check(mac, state->p_read.seqnr,
1577 sshbuf_ptr(state->incoming_packet),
1578 sshbuf_len(state->incoming_packet),
1579 sshbuf_ptr(state->input), maclen)) != 0) {
1580 if (r != SSH_ERR_MAC_INVALID)
1581 goto out;
1582 logit("Corrupted MAC on input.");
1583 if (need + block_size > PACKET_MAX_SIZE)
1584 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
1585 return ssh_packet_start_discard(ssh, enc, mac,
1586 sshbuf_len(state->incoming_packet),
1587 PACKET_MAX_SIZE - need - block_size);
1588 }
1589 /* Remove MAC from input buffer */
1590 DBG(debug("MAC #%d ok", state->p_read.seqnr));
1591 if ((r = sshbuf_consume(state->input, mac->mac_len)) != 0)
1592 goto out;
1593 }
1594 if (seqnr_p != NULL)
1595 *seqnr_p = state->p_read.seqnr;
1596 if (++state->p_read.seqnr == 0)
1597 logit("incoming seqnr wraps around");
1598 if (++state->p_read.packets == 0)
1599 if (!(ssh->compat & SSH_BUG_NOREKEY))
1600 return SSH_ERR_NEED_REKEY;
1601 state->p_read.blocks += (state->packlen + 4) / block_size;
1602 state->p_read.bytes += state->packlen + 4;
1603
1604 /* get padlen */
1605 padlen = sshbuf_ptr(state->incoming_packet)[4];
1606 DBG(debug("input: padlen %d", padlen));
1607 if (padlen < 4) {
1608 if ((r = sshpkt_disconnect(ssh,
1609 "Corrupted padlen %d on input.", padlen)) != 0 ||
1610 (r = ssh_packet_write_wait(ssh)) < 0)
1611 return r;
1612 return SSH_ERR_CONN_CORRUPT;
1613 }
1614
1615 /* skip packet size + padlen, discard padding */
1616 if ((r = sshbuf_consume(state->incoming_packet, 4 + 1)) != 0 ||
1617 ((r = sshbuf_consume_end(state->incoming_packet, padlen)) != 0))
1618 goto out;
1619
1620 DBG(debug("input: len before de-compress %zd",
1621 sshbuf_len(state->incoming_packet)));
1622 if (comp && comp->enabled) {
1623 sshbuf_reset(state->compression_buffer);
1624 if ((r = uncompress_buffer(ssh, state->incoming_packet,
1625 state->compression_buffer)) != 0)
1626 goto out;
1627 sshbuf_reset(state->incoming_packet);
1628 if ((r = sshbuf_putb(state->incoming_packet,
1629 state->compression_buffer)) != 0)
1630 goto out;
1631 DBG(debug("input: len after de-compress %zd",
1632 sshbuf_len(state->incoming_packet)));
1633 }
1634 /*
1635 * get packet type, implies consume.
1636 * return length of payload (without type field)
1637 */
1638 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(state->incoming_packet, typep)) != 0)
1639 goto out;
1640 if (ssh_packet_log_type(*typep))
1641 debug3("receive packet: type %u", *typep);
1642 if (*typep < SSH2_MSG_MIN || *typep >= SSH2_MSG_LOCAL_MIN) {
1643 if ((r = sshpkt_disconnect(ssh,
1644 "Invalid ssh2 packet type: %d", *typep)) != 0 ||
1645 (r = ssh_packet_write_wait(ssh)) < 0)
1646 return r;
1647 return SSH_ERR_PROTOCOL_ERROR;
1648 }
1649 if (state->hook_in != NULL &&
1650 (r = state->hook_in(ssh, state->incoming_packet, typep,
1651 state->hook_in_ctx)) != 0)
1652 return r;
1653 if (*typep == SSH2_MSG_USERAUTH_SUCCESS && !state->server_side)
1654 r = ssh_packet_enable_delayed_compress(ssh);
1655 else
1656 r = 0;
1657#ifdef PACKET_DEBUG
1658 fprintf(stderr, "read/plain[%d]:\r\n", *typep);
1659 sshbuf_dump(state->incoming_packet, stderr);
1660#endif
1661 /* reset for next packet */
1662 state->packlen = 0;
1663
1664 /* do we need to rekey? */
1665 if (ssh_packet_need_rekeying(ssh, 0)) {
1666 debug3("%s: rekex triggered", __func__);
1667 if ((r = kex_start_rekex(ssh)) != 0)
1668 return r;
1669 }
1670 out:
1671 return r;
1672}
1673
1674int
1675ssh_packet_read_poll_seqnr(struct ssh *ssh, u_char *typep, u_int32_t *seqnr_p)
1676{
1677 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
1678 u_int reason, seqnr;
1679 int r;
1680 u_char *msg;
1681
1682 for (;;) {
1683 msg = NULL;
1684 r = ssh_packet_read_poll2(ssh, typep, seqnr_p);
1685 if (r != 0)
1686 return r;
1687 if (*typep) {
1688 state->keep_alive_timeouts = 0;
1689 DBG(debug("received packet type %d", *typep));
1690 }
1691 switch (*typep) {
1692 case SSH2_MSG_IGNORE:
1693 debug3("Received SSH2_MSG_IGNORE");
1694 break;
1695 case SSH2_MSG_DEBUG:
1696 if ((r = sshpkt_get_u8(ssh, NULL)) != 0 ||
1697 (r = sshpkt_get_string(ssh, &msg, NULL)) != 0 ||
1698 (r = sshpkt_get_string(ssh, NULL, NULL)) != 0) {
1699 free(msg);
1700 return r;
1701 }
1702 debug("Remote: %.900s", msg);
1703 free(msg);
1704 break;
1705 case SSH2_MSG_DISCONNECT:
1706 if ((r = sshpkt_get_u32(ssh, &reason)) != 0 ||
1707 (r = sshpkt_get_string(ssh, &msg, NULL)) != 0)
1708 return r;
1709 /* Ignore normal client exit notifications */
1710 do_log2(ssh->state->server_side &&
1711 reason == SSH2_DISCONNECT_BY_APPLICATION ?
1712 SYSLOG_LEVEL_INFO : SYSLOG_LEVEL_ERROR,
1713 "Received disconnect from %s port %d:"
1714 "%u: %.400s", ssh_remote_ipaddr(ssh),
1715 ssh_remote_port(ssh), reason, msg);
1716 free(msg);
1717 return SSH_ERR_DISCONNECTED;
1718 case SSH2_MSG_UNIMPLEMENTED:
1719 if ((r = sshpkt_get_u32(ssh, &seqnr)) != 0)
1720 return r;
1721 debug("Received SSH2_MSG_UNIMPLEMENTED for %u",
1722 seqnr);
1723 break;
1724 default:
1725 return 0;
1726 }
1727 }
1728}
1729
1730/*
1731 * Buffers the given amount of input characters. This is intended to be used
1732 * together with packet_read_poll.
1733 */
1734
1735int
1736ssh_packet_process_incoming(struct ssh *ssh, const char *buf, u_int len)
1737{
1738 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
1739 int r;
1740
1741 if (state->packet_discard) {
1742 state->keep_alive_timeouts = 0; /* ?? */
1743 if (len >= state->packet_discard) {
1744 if ((r = ssh_packet_stop_discard(ssh)) != 0)
1745 return r;
1746 }
1747 state->packet_discard -= len;
1748 return 0;
1749 }
1750 if ((r = sshbuf_put(ssh->state->input, buf, len)) != 0)
1751 return r;
1752
1753 return 0;
1754}
1755
1756int
1757ssh_packet_remaining(struct ssh *ssh)
1758{
1759 return sshbuf_len(ssh->state->incoming_packet);
1760}
1761
1762/*
1763 * Sends a diagnostic message from the server to the client. This message
1764 * can be sent at any time (but not while constructing another message). The
1765 * message is printed immediately, but only if the client is being executed
1766 * in verbose mode. These messages are primarily intended to ease debugging
1767 * authentication problems. The length of the formatted message must not
1768 * exceed 1024 bytes. This will automatically call ssh_packet_write_wait.
1769 */
1770void __attribute__((__format__ (__printf__, 2, 3)))
1771ssh_packet_send_debug(struct ssh *ssh, const char *fmt,...)
1772{
1773 char buf[1024];
1774 va_list args;
1775 int r;
1776
1777 if ((ssh->compat & SSH_BUG_DEBUG))
1778 return;
1779
1780 va_start(args, fmt);
1781 vsnprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), fmt, args);
1782 va_end(args);
1783
1784 debug3("sending debug message: %s", buf);
1785
1786 if ((r = sshpkt_start(ssh, SSH2_MSG_DEBUG)) != 0 ||
1787 (r = sshpkt_put_u8(ssh, 0)) != 0 || /* always display */
1788 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh, buf)) != 0 ||
1789 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh, "")) != 0 ||
1790 (r = sshpkt_send(ssh)) != 0 ||
1791 (r = ssh_packet_write_wait(ssh)) < 0)
1792 fatal("%s: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1793}
1794
1795void
1796sshpkt_fmt_connection_id(struct ssh *ssh, char *s, size_t l)
1797{
1798 snprintf(s, l, "%.200s%s%s port %d",
1799 ssh->log_preamble ? ssh->log_preamble : "",
1800 ssh->log_preamble ? " " : "",
1801 ssh_remote_ipaddr(ssh), ssh_remote_port(ssh));
1802}
1803
1804/*
1805 * Pretty-print connection-terminating errors and exit.
1806 */
1807static void __attribute__((__format__ (__printf__, 3, 0)))
1808__attribute__((__noreturn__))
1809sshpkt_vfatal(struct ssh *ssh, int r, const char *fmt, va_list ap)
1810{
1811 char *tag = NULL, remote_id[512];
1812
1813 sshpkt_fmt_connection_id(ssh, remote_id, sizeof(remote_id));
1814
1815 switch (r) {
1816 case SSH_ERR_CONN_CLOSED:
1817 ssh_packet_clear_keys(ssh);
1818 logdie("Connection closed by %s", remote_id);
1819 case SSH_ERR_CONN_TIMEOUT:
1820 ssh_packet_clear_keys(ssh);
1821 logdie("Connection %s %s timed out",
1822 ssh->state->server_side ? "from" : "to", remote_id);
1823 case SSH_ERR_DISCONNECTED:
1824 ssh_packet_clear_keys(ssh);
1825 logdie("Disconnected from %s", remote_id);
1826 case SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR:
1827 if (errno == ECONNRESET) {
1828 ssh_packet_clear_keys(ssh);
1829 logdie("Connection reset by %s", remote_id);
1830 }
1831 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1832 case SSH_ERR_NO_CIPHER_ALG_MATCH:
1833 case SSH_ERR_NO_MAC_ALG_MATCH:
1834 case SSH_ERR_NO_COMPRESS_ALG_MATCH:
1835 case SSH_ERR_NO_KEX_ALG_MATCH:
1836 case SSH_ERR_NO_HOSTKEY_ALG_MATCH:
1837 if (ssh && ssh->kex && ssh->kex->failed_choice) {
1838 ssh_packet_clear_keys(ssh);
1839 logdie("Unable to negotiate with %s: %s. "
1840 "Their offer: %s", remote_id, ssh_err(r),
1841 ssh->kex->failed_choice);
1842 }
1843 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1844 default:
1845 if (vasprintf(&tag, fmt, ap) == -1) {
1846 ssh_packet_clear_keys(ssh);
1847 logdie("%s: could not allocate failure message",
1848 __func__);
1849 }
1850 ssh_packet_clear_keys(ssh);
1851 logdie("%s%sConnection %s %s: %s",
1852 tag != NULL ? tag : "", tag != NULL ? ": " : "",
1853 ssh->state->server_side ? "from" : "to",
1854 remote_id, ssh_err(r));
1855 }
1856}
1857
1858void __attribute__((__format__ (__printf__, 3, 4)))
1859__attribute__((__noreturn__))
1860sshpkt_fatal(struct ssh *ssh, int r, const char *fmt, ...)
1861{
1862 va_list ap;
1863
1864 va_start(ap, fmt);
1865 sshpkt_vfatal(ssh, r, fmt, ap);
1866 /* NOTREACHED */
1867 va_end(ap);
1868 logdie("%s: should have exited", __func__);
1869}
1870
1871/*
1872 * Logs the error plus constructs and sends a disconnect packet, closes the
1873 * connection, and exits. This function never returns. The error message
1874 * should not contain a newline. The length of the formatted message must
1875 * not exceed 1024 bytes.
1876 */
1877void
1878ssh_packet_disconnect(struct ssh *ssh, const char *fmt,...)
1879{
1880 char buf[1024], remote_id[512];
1881 va_list args;
1882 static int disconnecting = 0;
1883 int r;
1884
1885 if (disconnecting) /* Guard against recursive invocations. */
1886 fatal("packet_disconnect called recursively.");
1887 disconnecting = 1;
1888
1889 /*
1890 * Format the message. Note that the caller must make sure the
1891 * message is of limited size.
1892 */
1893 sshpkt_fmt_connection_id(ssh, remote_id, sizeof(remote_id));
1894 va_start(args, fmt);
1895 vsnprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), fmt, args);
1896 va_end(args);
1897
1898 /* Display the error locally */
1899 logit("Disconnecting %s: %.100s", remote_id, buf);
1900
1901 /*
1902 * Send the disconnect message to the other side, and wait
1903 * for it to get sent.
1904 */
1905 if ((r = sshpkt_disconnect(ssh, "%s", buf)) != 0)
1906 sshpkt_fatal(ssh, r, "%s", __func__);
1907
1908 if ((r = ssh_packet_write_wait(ssh)) < 0)
1909 sshpkt_fatal(ssh, r, "%s", __func__);
1910
1911 /* Close the connection. */
1912 ssh_packet_close(ssh);
1913 cleanup_exit(254);
1914}
1915
1916/*
1917 * Checks if there is any buffered output, and tries to write some of
1918 * the output.
1919 */
1920int
1921ssh_packet_write_poll(struct ssh *ssh)
1922{
1923 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
1924 int len = sshbuf_len(state->output);
1925 int r;
1926
1927 if (len > 0) {
1928 len = write(state->connection_out,
1929 sshbuf_ptr(state->output), len);
1930 if (len == -1) {
1931 if (errno == EINTR || errno == EAGAIN)
1932 return 0;
1933 return SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR;
1934 }
1935 if (len == 0)
1936 return SSH_ERR_CONN_CLOSED;
1937 if ((r = sshbuf_consume(state->output, len)) < 0)
1938 return r;
1939 }
1940 return len;
1941}
1942
1943/*
1944 * Calls packet_write_poll repeatedly until all pending output data has been
1945 * written.
1946 */
1947int
1948ssh_packet_write_wait(struct ssh *ssh)
1949{
1950 fd_set *setp;
1951 int ret, r, ms_remain = 0;
1952 struct timeval start, timeout, *timeoutp = NULL;
1953 u_int bytes_sent = 0;
1954 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
1955
1956 setp = calloc(howmany(state->connection_out + 1,
1957 NFDBITS), sizeof(fd_mask));
1958 if (setp == NULL)
1959 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
1960
1961 if ((r = ssh_packet_write_poll(ssh)) < 0) {
1962 free(setp);
1963 return r;
1964 }
1965 bytes_sent += r;
1966
1967 while (ssh_packet_have_data_to_write(ssh)) {
1968 memset(setp, 0, howmany(state->connection_out + 1,
1969 NFDBITS) * sizeof(fd_mask));
1970 FD_SET(state->connection_out, setp);
1971
1972 if (state->packet_timeout_ms > 0) {
1973 ms_remain = state->packet_timeout_ms;
1974 timeoutp = &timeout;
1975 }
1976 for (;;) {
1977 if (state->packet_timeout_ms != -1) {
1978 ms_to_timeval(&timeout, ms_remain);
1979 monotime_tv(&start);
1980 }
1981 if ((ret = select(state->connection_out + 1,
1982 NULL, setp, NULL, timeoutp)) >= 0)
1983 break;
1984 if (errno != EAGAIN && errno != EINTR)
1985 break;
1986 if (state->packet_timeout_ms == -1)
1987 continue;
1988 ms_subtract_diff(&start, &ms_remain);
1989 if (ms_remain <= 0) {
1990 ret = 0;
1991 break;
1992 }
1993 }
1994 if (ret == 0) {
1995 free(setp);
1996 return SSH_ERR_CONN_TIMEOUT;
1997 }
1998 if ((r = ssh_packet_write_poll(ssh)) < 0) {
1999 free(setp);
2000 return r;
2001 }
2002 bytes_sent += r;
2003 }
2004 free(setp);
2005 return bytes_sent;
2006}
2007
2008/* Returns true if there is buffered data to write to the connection. */
2009
2010int
2011ssh_packet_have_data_to_write(struct ssh *ssh)
2012{
2013 return sshbuf_len(ssh->state->output) != 0;
2014}
2015
2016/* Returns true if there is not too much data to write to the connection. */
2017
2018int
2019ssh_packet_not_very_much_data_to_write(struct ssh *ssh)
2020{
2021 if (ssh->state->interactive_mode)
2022 return sshbuf_len(ssh->state->output) < 16384;
2023 else
2024 return sshbuf_len(ssh->state->output) < 128 * 1024;
2025}
2026
2027void
2028ssh_packet_set_tos(struct ssh *ssh, int tos)
2029{
2030 if (!ssh_packet_connection_is_on_socket(ssh) || tos == INT_MAX)
2031 return;
2032 switch (ssh_packet_connection_af(ssh)) {
2033 case AF_INET:
2034 debug3("%s: set IP_TOS 0x%02x", __func__, tos);
2035 if (setsockopt(ssh->state->connection_in,
2036 IPPROTO_IP, IP_TOS, &tos, sizeof(tos)) < 0)
2037 error("setsockopt IP_TOS %d: %.100s:",
2038 tos, strerror(errno));
2039 break;
2040 case AF_INET6:
2041 debug3("%s: set IPV6_TCLASS 0x%02x", __func__, tos);
2042 if (setsockopt(ssh->state->connection_in,
2043 IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_TCLASS, &tos, sizeof(tos)) < 0)
2044 error("setsockopt IPV6_TCLASS %d: %.100s:",
2045 tos, strerror(errno));
2046 break;
2047 }
2048}
2049
2050/* Informs that the current session is interactive. Sets IP flags for that. */
2051
2052void
2053ssh_packet_set_interactive(struct ssh *ssh, int interactive, int qos_interactive, int qos_bulk)
2054{
2055 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
2056
2057 if (state->set_interactive_called)
2058 return;
2059 state->set_interactive_called = 1;
2060
2061 /* Record that we are in interactive mode. */
2062 state->interactive_mode = interactive;
2063
2064 /* Only set socket options if using a socket. */
2065 if (!ssh_packet_connection_is_on_socket(ssh))
2066 return;
2067 set_nodelay(state->connection_in);
2068 ssh_packet_set_tos(ssh, interactive ? qos_interactive :
2069 qos_bulk);
2070}
2071
2072/* Returns true if the current connection is interactive. */
2073
2074int
2075ssh_packet_is_interactive(struct ssh *ssh)
2076{
2077 return ssh->state->interactive_mode;
2078}
2079
2080int
2081ssh_packet_set_maxsize(struct ssh *ssh, u_int s)
2082{
2083 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
2084
2085 if (state->set_maxsize_called) {
2086 logit("packet_set_maxsize: called twice: old %d new %d",
2087 state->max_packet_size, s);
2088 return -1;
2089 }
2090 if (s < 4 * 1024 || s > 1024 * 1024) {
2091 logit("packet_set_maxsize: bad size %d", s);
2092 return -1;
2093 }
2094 state->set_maxsize_called = 1;
2095 debug("packet_set_maxsize: setting to %d", s);
2096 state->max_packet_size = s;
2097 return s;
2098}
2099
2100int
2101ssh_packet_inc_alive_timeouts(struct ssh *ssh)
2102{
2103 return ++ssh->state->keep_alive_timeouts;
2104}
2105
2106void
2107ssh_packet_set_alive_timeouts(struct ssh *ssh, int ka)
2108{
2109 ssh->state->keep_alive_timeouts = ka;
2110}
2111
2112u_int
2113ssh_packet_get_maxsize(struct ssh *ssh)
2114{
2115 return ssh->state->max_packet_size;
2116}
2117
2118void
2119ssh_packet_set_rekey_limits(struct ssh *ssh, u_int64_t bytes, u_int32_t seconds)
2120{
2121 debug3("rekey after %llu bytes, %u seconds", (unsigned long long)bytes,
2122 (unsigned int)seconds);
2123 ssh->state->rekey_limit = bytes;
2124 ssh->state->rekey_interval = seconds;
2125}
2126
2127time_t
2128ssh_packet_get_rekey_timeout(struct ssh *ssh)
2129{
2130 time_t seconds;
2131
2132 seconds = ssh->state->rekey_time + ssh->state->rekey_interval -
2133 monotime();
2134 return (seconds <= 0 ? 1 : seconds);
2135}
2136
2137void
2138ssh_packet_set_server(struct ssh *ssh)
2139{
2140 ssh->state->server_side = 1;
2141 ssh->kex->server = 1; /* XXX unify? */
2142}
2143
2144void
2145ssh_packet_set_authenticated(struct ssh *ssh)
2146{
2147 ssh->state->after_authentication = 1;
2148}
2149
2150void *
2151ssh_packet_get_input(struct ssh *ssh)
2152{
2153 return (void *)ssh->state->input;
2154}
2155
2156void *
2157ssh_packet_get_output(struct ssh *ssh)
2158{
2159 return (void *)ssh->state->output;
2160}
2161
2162/* Reset after_authentication and reset compression in post-auth privsep */
2163static int
2164ssh_packet_set_postauth(struct ssh *ssh)
2165{
2166 int r;
2167
2168 debug("%s: called", __func__);
2169 /* This was set in net child, but is not visible in user child */
2170 ssh->state->after_authentication = 1;
2171 ssh->state->rekeying = 0;
2172 if ((r = ssh_packet_enable_delayed_compress(ssh)) != 0)
2173 return r;
2174 return 0;
2175}
2176
2177/* Packet state (de-)serialization for privsep */
2178
2179/* turn kex into a blob for packet state serialization */
2180static int
2181kex_to_blob(struct sshbuf *m, struct kex *kex)
2182{
2183 int r;
2184
2185 if ((r = sshbuf_put_string(m, kex->session_id,
2186 kex->session_id_len)) != 0 ||
2187 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(m, kex->we_need)) != 0 ||
2188 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(m, kex->hostkey_alg)) != 0 ||
2189 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(m, kex->hostkey_type)) != 0 ||
2190 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(m, kex->hostkey_nid)) != 0 ||
2191 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(m, kex->kex_type)) != 0 ||
2192 (r = sshbuf_put_stringb(m, kex->my)) != 0 ||
2193 (r = sshbuf_put_stringb(m, kex->peer)) != 0 ||
2194 (r = sshbuf_put_stringb(m, kex->client_version)) != 0 ||
2195 (r = sshbuf_put_stringb(m, kex->server_version)) != 0 ||
2196 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(m, kex->flags)) != 0)
2197 return r;
2198 return 0;
2199}
2200
2201/* turn key exchange results into a blob for packet state serialization */
2202static int
2203newkeys_to_blob(struct sshbuf *m, struct ssh *ssh, int mode)
2204{
2205 struct sshbuf *b;
2206 struct sshcipher_ctx *cc;
2207 struct sshcomp *comp;
2208 struct sshenc *enc;
2209 struct sshmac *mac;
2210 struct newkeys *newkey;
2211 int r;
2212
2213 if ((newkey = ssh->state->newkeys[mode]) == NULL)
2214 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
2215 enc = &newkey->enc;
2216 mac = &newkey->mac;
2217 comp = &newkey->comp;
2218 cc = (mode == MODE_OUT) ? ssh->state->send_context :
2219 ssh->state->receive_context;
2220 if ((r = cipher_get_keyiv(cc, enc->iv, enc->iv_len)) != 0)
2221 return r;
2222 if ((b = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
2223 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
2224 if ((r = sshbuf_put_cstring(b, enc->name)) != 0 ||
2225 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(b, enc->enabled)) != 0 ||
2226 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(b, enc->block_size)) != 0 ||
2227 (r = sshbuf_put_string(b, enc->key, enc->key_len)) != 0 ||
2228 (r = sshbuf_put_string(b, enc->iv, enc->iv_len)) != 0)
2229 goto out;
2230 if (cipher_authlen(enc->cipher) == 0) {
2231 if ((r = sshbuf_put_cstring(b, mac->name)) != 0 ||
2232 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(b, mac->enabled)) != 0 ||
2233 (r = sshbuf_put_string(b, mac->key, mac->key_len)) != 0)
2234 goto out;
2235 }
2236 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u32(b, comp->type)) != 0 ||
2237 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(b, comp->name)) != 0)
2238 goto out;
2239 r = sshbuf_put_stringb(m, b);
2240 out:
2241 sshbuf_free(b);
2242 return r;
2243}
2244
2245/* serialize packet state into a blob */
2246int
2247ssh_packet_get_state(struct ssh *ssh, struct sshbuf *m)
2248{
2249 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
2250 int r;
2251
2252 if ((r = kex_to_blob(m, ssh->kex)) != 0 ||
2253 (r = newkeys_to_blob(m, ssh, MODE_OUT)) != 0 ||
2254 (r = newkeys_to_blob(m, ssh, MODE_IN)) != 0 ||
2255 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(m, state->rekey_limit)) != 0 ||
2256 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(m, state->rekey_interval)) != 0 ||
2257 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(m, state->p_send.seqnr)) != 0 ||
2258 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(m, state->p_send.blocks)) != 0 ||
2259 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(m, state->p_send.packets)) != 0 ||
2260 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(m, state->p_send.bytes)) != 0 ||
2261 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(m, state->p_read.seqnr)) != 0 ||
2262 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(m, state->p_read.blocks)) != 0 ||
2263 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(m, state->p_read.packets)) != 0 ||
2264 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(m, state->p_read.bytes)) != 0 ||
2265 (r = sshbuf_put_stringb(m, state->input)) != 0 ||
2266 (r = sshbuf_put_stringb(m, state->output)) != 0)
2267 return r;
2268
2269 return 0;
2270}
2271
2272/* restore key exchange results from blob for packet state de-serialization */
2273static int
2274newkeys_from_blob(struct sshbuf *m, struct ssh *ssh, int mode)
2275{
2276 struct sshbuf *b = NULL;
2277 struct sshcomp *comp;
2278 struct sshenc *enc;
2279 struct sshmac *mac;
2280 struct newkeys *newkey = NULL;
2281 size_t keylen, ivlen, maclen;
2282 int r;
2283
2284 if ((newkey = calloc(1, sizeof(*newkey))) == NULL) {
2285 r = SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
2286 goto out;
2287 }
2288 if ((r = sshbuf_froms(m, &b)) != 0)
2289 goto out;
2290#ifdef DEBUG_PK
2291 sshbuf_dump(b, stderr);
2292#endif
2293 enc = &newkey->enc;
2294 mac = &newkey->mac;
2295 comp = &newkey->comp;
2296
2297 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(b, &enc->name, NULL)) != 0 ||
2298 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(b, (u_int *)&enc->enabled)) != 0 ||
2299 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(b, &enc->block_size)) != 0 ||
2300 (r = sshbuf_get_string(b, &enc->key, &keylen)) != 0 ||
2301 (r = sshbuf_get_string(b, &enc->iv, &ivlen)) != 0)
2302 goto out;
2303 if ((enc->cipher = cipher_by_name(enc->name)) == NULL) {
2304 r = SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
2305 goto out;
2306 }
2307 if (cipher_authlen(enc->cipher) == 0) {
2308 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(b, &mac->name, NULL)) != 0)
2309 goto out;
2310 if ((r = mac_setup(mac, mac->name)) != 0)
2311 goto out;
2312 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(b, (u_int *)&mac->enabled)) != 0 ||
2313 (r = sshbuf_get_string(b, &mac->key, &maclen)) != 0)
2314 goto out;
2315 if (maclen > mac->key_len) {
2316 r = SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
2317 goto out;
2318 }
2319 mac->key_len = maclen;
2320 }
2321 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(b, &comp->type)) != 0 ||
2322 (r = sshbuf_get_cstring(b, &comp->name, NULL)) != 0)
2323 goto out;
2324 if (sshbuf_len(b) != 0) {
2325 r = SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
2326 goto out;
2327 }
2328 enc->key_len = keylen;
2329 enc->iv_len = ivlen;
2330 ssh->kex->newkeys[mode] = newkey;
2331 newkey = NULL;
2332 r = 0;
2333 out:
2334 free(newkey);
2335 sshbuf_free(b);
2336 return r;
2337}
2338
2339/* restore kex from blob for packet state de-serialization */
2340static int
2341kex_from_blob(struct sshbuf *m, struct kex **kexp)
2342{
2343 struct kex *kex;
2344 int r;
2345
2346 if ((kex = kex_new()) == NULL)
2347 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
2348 if ((r = sshbuf_get_string(m, &kex->session_id, &kex->session_id_len)) != 0 ||
2349 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(m, &kex->we_need)) != 0 ||
2350 (r = sshbuf_get_cstring(m, &kex->hostkey_alg, NULL)) != 0 ||
2351 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(m, (u_int *)&kex->hostkey_type)) != 0 ||
2352 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(m, (u_int *)&kex->hostkey_nid)) != 0 ||
2353 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(m, &kex->kex_type)) != 0 ||
2354 (r = sshbuf_get_stringb(m, kex->my)) != 0 ||
2355 (r = sshbuf_get_stringb(m, kex->peer)) != 0 ||
2356 (r = sshbuf_get_stringb(m, kex->client_version)) != 0 ||
2357 (r = sshbuf_get_stringb(m, kex->server_version)) != 0 ||
2358 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(m, &kex->flags)) != 0)
2359 goto out;
2360 kex->server = 1;
2361 kex->done = 1;
2362 r = 0;
2363 out:
2364 if (r != 0 || kexp == NULL) {
2365 kex_free(kex);
2366 if (kexp != NULL)
2367 *kexp = NULL;
2368 } else {
2369 kex_free(*kexp);
2370 *kexp = kex;
2371 }
2372 return r;
2373}
2374
2375/*
2376 * Restore packet state from content of blob 'm' (de-serialization).
2377 * Note that 'm' will be partially consumed on parsing or any other errors.
2378 */
2379int
2380ssh_packet_set_state(struct ssh *ssh, struct sshbuf *m)
2381{
2382 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
2383 const u_char *input, *output;
2384 size_t ilen, olen;
2385 int r;
2386
2387 if ((r = kex_from_blob(m, &ssh->kex)) != 0 ||
2388 (r = newkeys_from_blob(m, ssh, MODE_OUT)) != 0 ||
2389 (r = newkeys_from_blob(m, ssh, MODE_IN)) != 0 ||
2390 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(m, &state->rekey_limit)) != 0 ||
2391 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(m, &state->rekey_interval)) != 0 ||
2392 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(m, &state->p_send.seqnr)) != 0 ||
2393 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(m, &state->p_send.blocks)) != 0 ||
2394 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(m, &state->p_send.packets)) != 0 ||
2395 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(m, &state->p_send.bytes)) != 0 ||
2396 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(m, &state->p_read.seqnr)) != 0 ||
2397 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(m, &state->p_read.blocks)) != 0 ||
2398 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(m, &state->p_read.packets)) != 0 ||
2399 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(m, &state->p_read.bytes)) != 0)
2400 return r;
2401 /*
2402 * We set the time here so that in post-auth privsep slave we
2403 * count from the completion of the authentication.
2404 */
2405 state->rekey_time = monotime();
2406 /* XXX ssh_set_newkeys overrides p_read.packets? XXX */
2407 if ((r = ssh_set_newkeys(ssh, MODE_IN)) != 0 ||
2408 (r = ssh_set_newkeys(ssh, MODE_OUT)) != 0)
2409 return r;
2410
2411 if ((r = ssh_packet_set_postauth(ssh)) != 0)
2412 return r;
2413
2414 sshbuf_reset(state->input);
2415 sshbuf_reset(state->output);
2416 if ((r = sshbuf_get_string_direct(m, &input, &ilen)) != 0 ||
2417 (r = sshbuf_get_string_direct(m, &output, &olen)) != 0 ||
2418 (r = sshbuf_put(state->input, input, ilen)) != 0 ||
2419 (r = sshbuf_put(state->output, output, olen)) != 0)
2420 return r;
2421
2422 if (sshbuf_len(m))
2423 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
2424 debug3("%s: done", __func__);
2425 return 0;
2426}

2565int
2566sshpkt_get_end(struct ssh *ssh)
2567{
2568 if (sshbuf_len(ssh->state->incoming_packet) > 0)
2569 return SSH_ERR_UNEXPECTED_TRAILING_DATA;
2570 return 0;
2571}
2572
2573const u_char *
2574sshpkt_ptr(struct ssh *ssh, size_t *lenp)
2575{
2576 if (lenp != NULL)
2577 *lenp = sshbuf_len(ssh->state->incoming_packet);
2578 return sshbuf_ptr(ssh->state->incoming_packet);
2579}
2580
2581/* start a new packet */
2582
2583int
2584sshpkt_start(struct ssh *ssh, u_char type)
2585{
2586 u_char buf[6]; /* u32 packet length, u8 pad len, u8 type */
2587
2588 DBG(debug("packet_start[%d]", type));
2589 memset(buf, 0, sizeof(buf));
2590 buf[sizeof(buf) - 1] = type;
2591 sshbuf_reset(ssh->state->outgoing_packet);
2592 return sshbuf_put(ssh->state->outgoing_packet, buf, sizeof(buf));
2593}
2594
2595static int
2596ssh_packet_send_mux(struct ssh *ssh)
2597{
2598 struct session_state *state = ssh->state;
2599 u_char type, *cp;
2600 size_t len;
2601 int r;
2602
2603 if (ssh->kex)
2604 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
2605 len = sshbuf_len(state->outgoing_packet);
2606 if (len < 6)
2607 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
2608 cp = sshbuf_mutable_ptr(state->outgoing_packet);
2609 type = cp[5];
2610 if (ssh_packet_log_type(type))
2611 debug3("%s: type %u", __func__, type);
2612 /* drop everything, but the connection protocol */
2613 if (type >= SSH2_MSG_CONNECTION_MIN &&
2614 type <= SSH2_MSG_CONNECTION_MAX) {
2615 POKE_U32(cp, len - 4);
2616 if ((r = sshbuf_putb(state->output,
2617 state->outgoing_packet)) != 0)
2618 return r;
2619 /* sshbuf_dump(state->output, stderr); */
2620 }
2621 sshbuf_reset(state->outgoing_packet);
2622 return 0;
2623}
2624
2625/*
2626 * 9.2. Ignored Data Message
2627 *
2628 * byte SSH_MSG_IGNORE
2629 * string data
2630 *
2631 * All implementations MUST understand (and ignore) this message at any
2632 * time (after receiving the protocol version). No implementation is
2633 * required to send them. This message can be used as an additional
2634 * protection measure against advanced traffic analysis techniques.
2635 */
2636int
2637sshpkt_msg_ignore(struct ssh *ssh, u_int nbytes)
2638{
2639 u_int32_t rnd = 0;
2640 int r;
2641 u_int i;
2642
2643 if ((r = sshpkt_start(ssh, SSH2_MSG_IGNORE)) != 0 ||
2644 (r = sshpkt_put_u32(ssh, nbytes)) != 0)
2645 return r;
2646 for (i = 0; i < nbytes; i++) {
2647 if (i % 4 == 0)
2648 rnd = arc4random();
2649 if ((r = sshpkt_put_u8(ssh, (u_char)rnd & 0xff)) != 0)
2650 return r;
2651 rnd >>= 8;
2652 }
2653 return 0;
2654}
2655
2656/* send it */
2657
2658int
2659sshpkt_sendx(struct ssh *ssh)
2660{
2661 if (ssh->state && ssh->state->mux)
2662 return ssh_packet_send_mux(ssh);
2663 return ssh_packet_send2(ssh);
2664}
2665
2666int
2667sshpkt_send(struct ssh *ssh)
2668{
2669 int r = sshpkt_sendx(ssh);
2670 return r < 0 ? r : 0;
2671}
2672
2673int
2674sshpkt_disconnect(struct ssh *ssh, const char *fmt,...)
2675{
2676 char buf[1024];
2677 va_list args;
2678 int r;
2679
2680 va_start(args, fmt);
2681 vsnprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), fmt, args);
2682 va_end(args);
2683
2684 if ((r = sshpkt_start(ssh, SSH2_MSG_DISCONNECT)) != 0 ||
2685 (r = sshpkt_put_u32(ssh, SSH2_DISCONNECT_PROTOCOL_ERROR)) != 0 ||
2686 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh, buf)) != 0 ||
2687 (r = sshpkt_put_cstring(ssh, "")) != 0 ||
2688 (r = sshpkt_send(ssh)) != 0)
2689 return r;
2690 return 0;
2691}
2692
2693/* roundup current message to pad bytes */
2694int
2695sshpkt_add_padding(struct ssh *ssh, u_char pad)
2696{
2697 ssh->state->extra_pad = pad;
2698 return 0;
2699}
2700
2701int
2702ssh_packet_authentication_state(struct ssh *ssh)
2703{
2704 return ssh->state->after_authentication;
2705}
